review: It's a Chili's- made popular by awkward first teenage dates and large family gatherings. If you don't know the food then you haven't been living in the US in the past decade. This is a rather large Chili's that exists in it's little mall. Service for lunch was A OK, although the orders came out wrongish. If you order iced tea- they pretty much give you a bucket of it, which makes up for the order mistake in my book.  It was 114 degrees the day I went and the AC was working very well. That's worth all the good service in the world to me!

Service was slow, waitress did not come around until after we received our food which by that time all of our drinks were empty. Ordered an old timer with a black bean patty. I specifically told her "no" when she asked if I wanted cheese. Burger came with cheese, had I wanted cheese I'd have been highly disappointed as it was almost indistinguishable but for the crispy bits on the side. When my burger came back it came with fries and garlic pickles thrown on the side, no mustard and a mushy black bean patty that wouldn't stay together. The 2 stars is due to the 3 other people being satisfied with their food. The last time we ate at a Chili's (Santa Clarita) the service and food (mine) were also unsatisfactory.

my family met another family at this restaurant on tuesday 12/26/2017. the restaurant was crowded but because of the online reservation, we were seated quickly and the server took our drink and appetizer order. a few minutes later, we ordered and the food came out quickly... I have to tell you: I rarely leave negative feed back for a restaurant but this time I was really disappointed.  my daughters quesadilla salad was not edible. The leaves of lettuce throughout the dish were brown and wilted, the chicken was undercooked and had a mysterious slimy coating, the entire dish including the quesadilla slices was drowned in waaay too much dressing. no part of the the entire dish was edible. unfortunately, she did not say anything until after I had closed out the check.  another thing that was not pleasant: the Ziosk tablet computer terminal that was left at our table was covered in what felt like the last several hundred customer's sauces and sugary drinks which had dried to a sticky / greasy mess on the exterior surface of the device. when I went to pay the bill my hand was instantly contaminated with the food residue from what felt like every patron who had ever sat at that table. I actually had to wipe the screen clear of dried sauce just so i could sign the bill. just plain disgusting. I mentioned the situation to the waiter and he said it was because they were so crowded and understaffed. I get it. It is not the waiters fault. I would expect a chain like chili's to at least offer to the terrible salad off the ticket but they did not.  I find it disappointing that a big chain restaurant like chili's would have a nice family dining experience destroyed by careless housekeeping and a terrible presentation on such a simple dish. Maybe this was just an off night for this restaurant's staff... but I can tell you that I will not be back to this location to find out.

Chili's was busy this afternoon, we waited 15 min before getting a seat. I don't mind the wait, but there was empty tables and tables that had not been cleared off from the last guest plates and drinks (seemed that someone called out or restaurant is short staffed). I ordered the spinach queso dip for me and my wife to share. Dip was good, however the paper thin chips did not work well for scooping dip (need to upgrade to a thicker chip). Also I ordered the old timer cheese burger, this is a great burger, fresh patty I had cooked medium and would definitely order again. Overall the staff was friendly and did the best they could.

1st star for dining-in tableside guacamole 2nd star for the awesome cookie skillet dessert we got complimentary for a birthday bonus~ Thanks Chilis! We've tried visiting this location now on several occasions. We typically don't dine in, but did so a few weeks ago and I forgot to do a review then. Service dining in went well and our server was great and attentive at the bar. Our table can now order and pay our bills with their tablets actually, but our drinks and tableside guacamole Service still kept us content.  However, on a more recent visit this evening, and like many takeout service evenings, it's very disappointing. Hoping our critique can help improve their training. Called to place an order for guacamole, queso, chips and salsa. First call, young lady transfers us to takeout but disconnects us. Photos will display this sequence of events. Called back and we were in hold for 8+min so we hopped in the car to just drive there and for giggles stayed on the line to see if we would beat them to picking up our call. Since I wasn't driving I proceed to place my order online, rummage around emails and password retrievals, place the order online by 8:20 Sat PM and online confirmation stayed it'd be ready by 8:40. (20 min) We park and I wait in the car on hold while my guy picks up the food. End of the story I am on hold for almost 30 min. My guy exits WITH our takeout in hand before anyone even picked up the phone. It was hilarious, after all was said and done. The only saving element to our experience tonight was that logging in to our Chili's account I learned we had a birthday dessert credit and could be redeemed tonight. So, left with a delicious cookie and vanilla ice cream skillet treat. Hope their takeout service improves and take our notes to heart. Thanks!!

My wife and I come here regularly and we've always had a great experience, but this last visit went from what could have been a bad experience to a really great one. Our appetizer was a little cold so we they offered to bring a new order without question, but it ended up coming at the same as our entree which I was bummed about, but then Mel the manager offered us the appetizer on the house and I thought that was really cool. They could have not really cared, because it wasn't that huge of a deal, but they went out of their way to make sure their customers were satisfied and that's rare to find in restaurants these days. Thanks everyone! We will definitely continue to keep coming back!

Great food! Have had great prior experiences here But tonight was distasteful  Walked in when employees were cleaning chandeliers rather than providing service  The male waiter we had not one asked us if we needed anything  Disrespectful as ever At the end when he did ask if we wanted dessert  He walked away  Sad to say he took more interest in regulars

Honestly if there was a TGI Friday's in Lake Elsinore I'd be goin there instead of chili's... had an experience where someone threw their Insulin Needle under the table! When we sat down no one swept under the table, my son's crayon fell & I looked under the table to grab it & that's when I found it... told our waiter( the only Hispanic waiter they have) & he was like whatever about it! Had another experience with this same waiter( He's usually in the bar area) we ordered an extra shot for our Margaritas & it wasn't a full shot... my husband jokingly ask for a cheaper price cuz we were cheated, & he says " look be thankful that there cheap in price already, & walked away.. so Rude & Arrogant!
I come here often and always satisfied with the food and customer service. Love their margaritas and mini cheeseburgers!

SERIOUSLY Chili's ?????????????????????????? I gave them a try like a month ago their Caribbean salad was great so, I decided to have the same salad again because I think is the only thing I like from their menu. Well, to balance the diet I ordered a classic Margarita which is served in their signature Patrón shaker. what I got! so disappointed!!!  I never expected to have a margarita in a GLASS and it doesn't even taste great... 4/15 Caribbean salad delicious as always, I got a watermelon Margarita very very delicious and properly served!!! Great server, thanks Megan!

Let me start by saying that chili's is one of my favorite restaurants but this location in lake elsinore is not a good place to eat. My husband and I had the worst experience. We ordered the fries and cheese jalapeno appetizer and it was over cooked and left solid as a rock. So we asked them to exchange it for the traditional cheese and chips appetizer and that was awful. We should of got up and left but we didnt. We said maybe the steak meal will be delicious like at all the other chili's restaurants. We were served 2 sirloin steaks with their loaded mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli. My steak was not done the way I asked so it was taken back to cook a little longer and it got burnt. The mashed potatoes were very dry on both plates and broccoli was barely steamed. We will not be going to this location ever again. Also the restaurant was very dusty where we were sitting the wall between the booths were very dusty like they haven't been cleaned for weeks.
Came in with my family and the environment is very family friendly, you get seated right away & the food also gets to your table right away! Our server Summer was very polite and quick on her feet!
We always love our chips and sauce and bartender is so kind and on top of everything . Happy hour prices are great and will be back. Our bartender told us of the best deals!!!
Kathy was our server!! Service was great! My steak was over cooked, manager fixed right away!!!!!! Their service is outstanding!! Ask for Kathy folks she is Awesome!!

My Husband and I came for  lunch. There was no line, and we were escorted to our seats right away. Our waitress Stephanie  was polite  and patient as it took my husband and I forever to decide what we wanted.she came back and checked on us often to see  if  there was anything else she could do for us. I recommend asking for her tables. The food was good it was hot, fresh, and really flavorful.

The wait was horrendous, 50min wait for a table when i clearly seen a few empty  Had to ask for refills Took forever for food to come Food was salty as fuck, could only stomach about half my steak, broccoli could give a person kidney stones This place blows

I came in with my sister in law 3 girls and 1 teenager on a Friday night, yes I understand that it's Friday and busy but when they tell you the wait is 20-30 minutes and you end up waiting 45 minutes because the guy that was supposed to check you did not even bother to do his job that is very unacceptable, until they sat everyone else down and they saw me bothered by the wait he asked what was my name..... he looked me up and I was not even on the list for the wait.... gladly the server was a nice guy and really treated us right and made sure the girls where served promptly.  I'm still sitting here and I hope to update the stars by the end of the service being provided by my serve whom has been really good.  If I were the manage I would definitely approach those waiting so long and apologized for the wait.... I know customer service and the only good customer service I have received here has been by the serve.

I've been there quite a few times always enjoy either item combo the order two for 35 deal with my friend the food is cooked good very I'm not in your mouth on that steak and the potatoes are delicious as well.

I met my friends at the restaurant and we were sitting in a booth talking and I noticed that there was a LARGE cockroach walking past my friends head on the ledge. I said something, we immediately jumped up. I got the attention of server and she didn't seem to bothered. She grabbed a broom and tried to kill it (not sure if she did). We said we wanted our check immediately and a few min later the manager came up to us and apologized but made some BS excuse about construction. He did comp our meal and we got out of there fast. It was so disgusting and we will never be eating there again. Where there is one cockroach THERE IS MORE!!!!

While Chili's has never disappointed before, I'm sad to say they now have. The lunch portion was pathetic. The fries tasted as though they were reheated, the portion was tiny, and it came out cold. Very saddened by this experience. I would not recommend.
The people are nice, the food is good. Sometimes it's crowded, would be nice if they expanded the dinning room. Great place for family meals.

We always have excellent service at Chili's. It was one of our to- go- to places until they made their last update to their menu. My husband still has his favorites on the menu, however mine have left. The Southwest salad is gone; the Chicken, bacon, avocado sandwich is available but the pretzel roll is gone. I like the salmon but only like it broiled, not with all the sauces and spices. The Chili's in Lake Elsinore will accommodate me, however, in Hemet, I have to scrape off the spices they cook on the salmon plus they don't cook it done enough for me and no matter how many times I have asked them, they still cook it "their" way. Also, we were very disappointed when they stopped carrying Red Trolley Beer at the bar. Now visit Red Robin more often than Chili's
2nd time in here in a month. It took 30 mins for an appetizer in the bar sitting at the bar. TEALKY SHIITY SERVICE FROM THE KITCHEN

Did the Togo order for the first time. Thought t was cool curbside service is what's advertised so that seemed interesting. Waited in the car. Nobody came. Went inside. Waited 3 people walked passed me before a girl came and asked if I had a Togo order. She proceeded to ring me out, handed me the receipt and picked up a phone call. No have a good night. No thanks. No nothing. Customer service goes a long way. Even if you're busy.

I love Chilis. But this restaurant never fills the presidente up. Ever. I go to Chilis once a week and this is the only one that fills their drinks up 3/4 and then acts like it's ok. Very disappointing. Sitting here drinking my 1st 3/4 of a drink now.

Eh, i went this afternoon and my bartender was Katy Perry's less attractive sister. She lost a star when I was sitting there for 5 minutes and she helped a couple that came in after me.  She lost another star when there appeared to be only one salt shaker at the bar and instead of finding more, just passed the single shaker around to different people when they asked for the salt.  This place lost another star when I started biting into something hard and crunchy that tasted horrible in my sandwich and my sandwich didn't have anything hard and crunchy in it. Luckily I was at the end of the sandwich so I just quit eating it and didn't have to send it back.  All in all one thing that would help this place out would be attractive, younger bartenders with a bit of personality and awareness.

Waited for a half hour for our server Jake we sat there just waiting to order drinks and never showed up. My fiancé and I were wanting but the wait just to get drinks was way too long for a place that was not that busy.  We got tired of waiting and left.
Savannah had taken our order over the phone for pick up. She had it ready for my family in less than 10 minutes! Friendly and positive customer service thanks for making it quick and easy.

Was here on 9/1/17. Ordered the chicken bacon avocado sandwich. It was really good the chicken was very juicy. Their plain iced tea tasted like it had beneb make with sink water and was not that great. As for the service, it was a long wait because it was a Friday. When we did get seated the waiter seemed a little to comfortable and would sit down next to us each time he would check on us which I did not like. Food was great but service was a little annoying.

this is the final time i will ever visit this chilis every time its same b.s how ever this time was the worst,i arrived at 535 pm to go person told me that she cant take my order until she finishes the order in front of me. 555 pm she takes my order then tells me it will be 25 minutes which puts it at 635 approx.they could have taken my order when i got here because they were slow and mel told every body since it was slow to take their brakes so he can lick up and go home at 1035 pm.this is un called for and as a customer i am done  with chilis.

Worst dining experience ever. Wrong drinks brought to us. Waitress took our order then threw it away, we ordered again. Forgot to bring correct drinks. Asked someone else and finally got the right drinks. Salads never came. Was supposed to get dessert I didn't even ask for it because it was such a terrible restaurant. Check was all messed up. Got charged for the wrong drinks that we didn't even order.

My family & I went here to celebrate my nephew's 1st birthday. Service was fine. We ordered White Queso Dip & Chips which was really good, Triple Dipper (Crispy Cheese Bites, Original Chicken Crispers, & Big Mouth Bites) & Loaded White Queso Make-A-Trio Fajitas (Steak, Shrimp, & Chicken). The white queso should have been on top of the fajitas, but they forgot to serve the fajitas with it so they just served it on the side. But, I really like their medium-rare 10oz Classic Sirloin. I asked them to change then sides to Loaded Mashed Potatoes & Corn on the cob. I was very satisfied with my meal. All tasted delicious.

Horrid service. Took about 5 mins before someone came for our drink order and another 20 before the drinks and salads came. Then the food came out in waves, with the child's meal coming out last and about 10 mins after the rest of the food. The manager came out to deliver the child's meal and didn't even wait to see if there was anything else we needed. We had to keep asking a different waiter for assistance because ours was so unavailable. Then the waitress has the audacity to complain that they are understaffed. Being in customer service, you should never complain to the customer or make excuses. Overall experience was subpar and very disappointing.

Horrible kitchen staff. One of our orders is always wrong whether we dine in or do take out. Its like they cant read the ticket. Tonight was the last time we are ever gonna order from there. We've given them to many opportunities to get it together, and all we are doing is wasting our money each time.

I came in with my brother son and brother in law. Drove 1 hour to visit with family and we ended up here on Sunday. Wait was 20 minutes not too bad right?! The front hostess didn't look too happy super busy I assumed. We get seated and our server Barry was very happy from start to finish. He checked on us to ensure our needs were met. I absolutely loved my spicy mango chicken. Sweetest waiter I've met yet. Thank you Barry for interacting with us and wonderful customer service. Hope to get you next time. You made our experience complete. That smile though!

Worst service ever !!!  Me and my bf are huge fans of chilis . We love chilis so much we go at least 7x's a month. We drove to lake Elsinore a couple nights ago and decided to eat dinner at our favorite restaurant . So we went in and there were a lot of empty tables so we were like "great! We'll get quick service!" We were wrong. We waited at least 10 minutes for our server to great us and then another 10-15 for our drinks ! I have no idea where the staff was because even the few couple tables around us seemed un satisfied because their servers were taking long as well. After ordering our food we waited a good 30 minutes for our food yet when I go to other chilis restaurants and they are sooo busy we always wait no more than 10 minutes ! When I FINALLY got the fajitas I ordered they were cold and 'there were ingredients missing (salsa, the cheese, the pico de gallo, sour cream , and the guac) -.- and I asked the server and she said the cook must have forgotten -.- when we were done with our meals and wanted to pay we waited another 30 minutes because our server was no where to be found and our ziosk was not working .  I love chilis but this location has reallyyyy bad service.
Seen the bartender 1 time ordered food 20 minutes ago and the salad hasn't come out yet. Multiple employees standing around chit  chatting, and im still hungry.

This Chili's has really improved their food and customer service from a few years ago. When I first moved to Lake Elsinore 4 years ago I went here to eat. The food was terrible, the service was terrible and it was just an overall bad experience. I thought maybe it was just a bad day that we all have. So I went there again the following week. The same terrible experience. Then a few months ago after not being back for a few years I took my two young sons there to eat since we couldn't figure anything else out. I was expecting the same poor service and bad food. To my surprise the service was great and so was the food. The servers and I assume managers or hosts kept checking in on us to make sure we had everything we needed and to do if we were satisfied with our meals. Was a great experience. Today, decided to give it another try. So I went out on a limb and took my girlfriend and her daughter there because they have a decent kid friendly menu. Again, the service was great and the food was good. I don't know what happened to make them turn around for the better but whatever it was I'm glad they did. They regained a customer.

We just left this place. We waited 15 min for a table. Noone acknowledged our existence. I had to yell out HELLO! And still not one of the wait staff paid any attention.  One waitress gave us dirty looks, another man came and said someone would be right with is..  someone finally showed up and acted like she was going to seat us, but then went to a different table to take an order.  There were other people now waiting and they couldnt believe how badly we all were being treated.  We decided to leave after taking a business card.  Im not even going to bother calling now. Im calling corporate. This place was trashy. And ill never go ever ever ever ever ever again. Ever. I dont want any coupoms. I dont want a gift card. I dont want an apology. It was truly a nasty experience and i feel soiled for just being in the lobby.   We are going to Rock n Brews in corona. They always have Bomb food and are super friendly.   You can call me back after you replace your entire staff.

I love coming to chili's to sit at the bar and order a cocktail. Never have a bad time and the bartenders are amazing! Especially Scottie and Meeeeagan!!!! They are the reason I keep coming back. Oh and the smoke house combos seriously is the best combo, it's a must order. For the amount of food you get, for the price you seriously can't go wrong.

LOVE COMING HERE ! We were greeted immediately and sat within two minutes (great job host). Our server Aaron (very friendly) greeted us and took our drink order; meanwhile I can see he has some big parties around but still got our drinks quickly and took our order without delay. Our chips and guac took about twenty minutes to come out(which was a little longer but.... Still yummy!) and five minutes after that our food came out warm and delicious. The food is always great and so is the service; I definitely recommend this place to anyone and everyone !

Great service every time we come here. But tonight was by far the best service we received. Katherine and Kamy were amazing servers and hostesses. Katherine recommended the blackberry presidente margarita, and it was AMAZING!!!! Thank you ladies for such great service and making our night a great one.
Bianca is the best! I can't stress the fact of how wonderful, excellent, marvelous, well you get the picture! I will return to this restaurant because of her!!

Stoped in to take advantage of their Veterans Day special menu and WOW. I was blow away with how friendly and attentive the entire staff was today. We were greeted and seated quickly and thanked for our service as veterans by everyone we spoke too. The manager even stopped by twice to express, what I believed as a sincere thank you to my father who is also Vet. The veterans special menu was incredible and the portions were huge. I couldn't have been happier with the staff, the service or the experience. Thanks Chili's! My family and I will be back next Veterans Day and many more times in between. :)

Came here tonight for dinner with my boyfriend. The wait to be seated wasn't too long but the half booth they seated us at was pretty dirty. My boyfriend ordered a "watermelon" lemonade, I put that in quotations because there wasn't really any kind of watermelon flavor to it. It tasted like a watered down version of that pink lemonade you get at in n out. We asked the waiter for a different drink to replace this one.  My boyfriend ordered some wings and the shrimp tacos. I ordered the crispy style chicken crispers. My boyfriend liked his wings and said the the shrimp tacos were actually spicy, and he isn't weak to spicy like I am. I enjoyed my crispy chicken crispers that are served with French fries (nothing special) and corn on the cob :D Something really neat at Chili's is this little touch screen device they have on all the tables called a Ziosk. You can play games on it (for a fee). You can cruise drinks, desserts & appetizers on it and you can pay your check on it!  We noticed that the "watermelon" lemonade hadn't been removed from the bill, my boyfriend mentioned it to the waiter and he took it off. We decided to pay using the Ziosk. The Ziosk also prints out your receipt!  All in all not a bad evening :-)

Came to have dinner...watch the game and maybe grab a drink... Walked in to dirty plates sitting on the table and everyone just walking past us like they had no desire to clean them away. .bartender grabbed them and moved it across to the other side of the bar (still there 20 minutes later)  Then when i  ask for a menu she informs me everything i need to order is on the computer which has nothing on it..not to mention it was sticky and stuck to the counter.. Finally i get a menu from her and it's covered in food...SeriouSly chick clean your menu!! Let's move onto ordering drinks...one beer one pineapple  margarita...two dirty glasses...handed to us by the top of the glass where she expects our mouths to go...um no bitch not happening.  At this point Im done.  I'm not a fancy girl or high maintenance but i would like a clean glass and place to sit. After all those rolled up into not wanting anything at all from that place we decided to speak to a manager about not paying for our drinks we didnt touch and leave.   We waited 15 minutes for a manager to inform us that he was understaffed tonight and he was sorry and we were welcome to leave in his most smart ass wanna be punched in the throat voice. I know this will fix nothing...but it made me feel better. Now off to someplace far better!!

I love this location. The rib eye was incredible.  I love the table side guacamole,  they make it right in front of you and it taste great. Our servers were fantastic as well. The management does well to ensure this is ran properly.  I recommend the guacamole and the steak to all who go here.  Although my mother enjoys the chicken salads too

Came in as a party of 2, hostess greeted us then said let me find a table  (seating chart is at hostess stand) , saw her walk to the back of the restaurant and looked to be texting at back wait station, she then sat us. Along the way several tables including  a large table were full of dirty dishes and no one seemed to care as they walked by of the condition  of the  dirty tables. Waiter came introduced himself, took drink order and walked off, since beverages ordered were non alcoholic, it seemed to take a bit before he returned. Restaurant did not appear busy yet. Waiter then asked if we were ready to order, we asked for a couple minutes, he returned took our order, and then we never saw him again, other servers brought our food. I ordered the ribs much to my disappointment they were lacking meat but slathered in barbecue sauce, the asparagus was thin and very unappetizing.  My son's burger was dry and not once were our beverages checked. We had to ask for our check. Service and quality  was so poor, we won't return even though we participate in school and other fund raising here, we won't be  any longer.

I was just on hold for over 20 minutes to order to go! I pulled into the to-go parking and still have not ordered. I look inside to see no one at the to-go register picking up calls .. So I hang up and and call back again only to be told to hold once again.  As I'm waiting I look in again and I see a worker at the cashier fidgeting with plastic forks, still not picking up the phone to take my order. After a total of 30 minutes of holding sitting in the to-go parking, I decided to leave. I hung up and called back, asking to speak to the manager, only to be told once again by the same girl to hold once again. I didn't call back again. She sounded lazy and careless. Very poor service at this location.

If I could give zero stars I would. I was driving through California and decided to stop for dinner. Worst mistake ever. I waited well over 45 min to be seated. I heard the hostess say, "Oh my gosh! I forgot about them!" They put us in the bar, I explicitly told them I didn't want to sit in the bar and she said, "Well, this is all I've got." An out and out lie, and walked away. There were several empty tables in the dining room. We waited another fifteen minutes for a server to show up to take our drink order. Our food order was cold and when I asked to speak to a manager he acted like it wasn't his job to help people. I asked his name, as he wasn't wearing a name tag, and he refused to give it to me.  This guy should lose his job. Period.

The husband and I wanted to stay local so we decided to go to Chilis.  The service here is usually ok, nothing to rave about but decent. Well Saturday night service was awful. It started when we were seated. The waitress was in a super rush taking our drink order and when the blackberry iced teas came out, they tasted awful. She did what she could to make the drinks right so I figured no big deal. We ordered an appetizer and shortly afterwards we ordered our meals. The appetizer came out just fine and my husband, daughter and I enjoyed it. Well then the real issues came about. We sat for at least 45 minutes and our actual meals still hadn't come out. My husband flagged down the waitress to find out what the hold up was. She went to check and came out with my daughters food (kids corn dog meal) which was piping hot that she couldn't even eat it. At this point I'm just pissed. They obviously put a rush on the kids meal or else why was it so hot? I think they forgot to put our order in. Well I flagged down the waitress and asked her to call the manager over to our table. When the manager came over he apologized for the delay and said the food would be out shortly. I mean he did try to make it right, I'm not going to lie. But at that point it was well close to an hour and our food still hadn't come out. He said he was going to take care of the bill for us and asked if we wanted our food to go. I was so done I didn't want any food to go. I just wanted to get out of there and honestly I wasn't even hungry anymore . I've worked in a restaurant before so I am usually extremely understanding when it comes to kitchen screw ups or wait staff issues but the thing is I had to flag down our waitress to find out where our food was. She should have come over and explained and apologized for the delay before I asked to speak to a manager. Oh and we also noticed that two parties that were sat after us, were done and leaving because they had already eaten. And here we were still waiting for our food.  Needless to say, we won't be coming back here anytime soon. I would rather make the drive to the Murrieta location where we have always had good service. It's sad though cause we like to spend our money locally.

I came here to have a quick meal with my aunt and grandmother and knew right away what we wanted to eat. Right when we walked in it took 4 minutes of looking around before the sever came to us. After that she did help us on our choices of food by doing to two for $20, but after that it went downhill. Forgot the salad my aunt ordered then it came to my aunt as she was eating her entree. She just seemed overwhelmed and busy but only had 3 tables.  Being I'm a server I understand but at the same time I understand great guest service! A meal especially at a casual dining shouldn't be a almost 2 hour meal! But we will come again bc we so like it and it's always usually fast. I
The meals were the right portions and the service was great. Our server got a 20% tip because we were so pleased.

I had dinner here tonight and I was pleasantly surprised! Our appetizer came out quickly and steaming hot. Our drinks were always filled without having to say anything. Dinner was delicious! Thank you for the great customer service and good experience! :))

We again tried chilies out for lunch on Thursday and service was bad they wanted us to use their machine to pay our bill but it wasn't working but nobody came over.  The machine had to reboot and that took forever they should have just took our money and let us leave.  This is the last time we will be going there we are done with chilies I don't even think it deserves a star.
I eat here 2 or 3 times a week and always have a great experience. The loaded wings are amazing.

I have been to many different chili's so I do enjoy these restaurants.  We went last night and this is my experience from then. When walking in a host was holding the door for us.  After we walked in we were seated right away. Our server came up quickly and asked for our drink orders and then gave us some time to look over the menu. I noticed at that point they didn't give my son a kid menu. So my son went up and got one on his own. Our server came back and took our order and we had an issue with that tablet thing at our table (our kids wanted to play and it didn't work). Our server then reset it and soon after our apetizer came out. Soon after that our food came out.  The food was great as usual. Always a pleasure when we are waited on by  Sal. Customer service is iffy from others but if you get Sal you know your food will be prepared properly and brought out while still fresh. Great quick place for lunch, or when you just don't feel like cooking.

The margaritas are awesome and a must try. Probably their most unique drinks. The food is typically good but as of late has been slowly slipping downward.

This place is awful. Food is not very good and the service is.even worse. We live down the street  so we have been there a few times since it's the only restaurant  around. But every time we go it's disappointing.

So.....here goes... Why am I reviewing Chili's?  It's a damn chain and I do not frequently review chains - certainly not one like Chili's as everyone has already been to one and they are very consistent - using the same processes, suppliers, training, etc.  but I have to say - when you have two little ones and the waitresses are so amazingly wonderful it is refreshing.  Our 2 year old loves this place.  Porsche our regular waitress is a hero.  For the convenience- and the fact our 2 year old says lets go to Chilis we are here maybe too often.  My wife takes the two kids here for lunch when shopping and one time the waitress helped her carry the baby supplies to the car after a mishap - just an amazing and brave group of servers.  I like the table side guacamole - you have had everything I am sure - but that guacamole is all I need - kids happy - wife happy - servers amazing at making us feel so comfortable with the little ones.

This place has gone down hill so badly in the last year or so. It used to be a favorite, especially when Porshe worked there. Now the staff is either spread so thin because they don't believe in Customer Service or they are unmanaged and standing around talking. The current manager needs to be thrown out on his face and the original brought back! Once again, a Lake Elsinore business crumbling to the ground because they just don't care! Best if you go to another location, because Chili's food, when it's hot is delicious. Problem is, this place no longer knows how to serve it that way. Given all these reviews, evidently the District Manager is a "Yes" man and doesn't have a backbone or a heart. I had to stand by a dirty table in the bar for over 5 minutes before it got cleaned. The waitress came by in a reasonable amount of time to take my drink order and then took almost 15 minutes to bring it. The food was another excruciatingly long wait and was only warm when it got there. If you don't care about your time or food, this is the place for you. I could manage this place better and I haven't worked in a restaurant for 30 years.

They blew it with us, two Sundays in a row. I used to like this place because the service was consistently good and the food was fresh and well prepared. In a town starving for good restaurants, it was nice to know you could count on Chilis Lake Elsinore. Yeah they offered to redo it, but that's not reasonable when your wife is already eating and you have time limitations. A restaurant needs to get it right the first time.  So we went back a week later after one bad meal because they promised it wouldn't happen again but it did, so I'm done with Chilis. On a separate visit at the bar, they also blew it. They don't know how to make a Long Island Ice Tea. Tasted horrible, after I sent two back, I gave up . Service at the table was still good but I was very dissatisfied with the food and believe the cook should be fired.

WORST SERVICE EVER! Only received two stars because cooks working always seems to be consistent. I have heard the manager physically yelling at employees. This place is lame.  Even though there are plenty of available tables, they make u wait 15-20 mins for absolutely no reason. Eat and drink here 3 or 4 times a week. Food is always good bartenders are awesome. Can get a little busy when there's a big game on especially friday night happy hour.
Driving back to SD on the 15. Decided to stop for some food at Chilis. Server was nice and attentive, but food took over 30 minutes to be served. It was a slow Saturday noon.

Just went here today. The atmosphere was nice. Staff was very friendly. We were having a Bridal Shower. Our group was large. The chips and salsa was delicious. I love how the salsa tasted like it was just made, very fresh tomatoes. My son ordered pizza and salad, it looked great. I had the Grilled Chicken with Mac and Cheese. It was delicious! The cheese was perfect. I loved that it was baked so the cheese and bread crumbs had a crispy, oooey, goooey, cheeeewy top. Our group really had a great time. Our server was awesome too. The only thing I noticed was the women's restroom was dirty.

This Chilis is hard for me to rate.  I should give them 1 star but I've had good meals here in the past, so I give them 2 stars.  I have been there several times and loved it.  I go there after a good workout at the nearby L.A. Fitness to put back on all the fat I had just burned off.  And that usually means a good time. But this time, I may have gotten sick there.  I had their "All you can eat soup and salad" and ice tea.  (Usually, I have a few beers, but I'm trying!)  I had two bowls of Terlingua Chili and two salads with vinegarette dressing. While eating the chili, I chewed on a piece of meat that just wasn't right.  I didn't want to spit it out in front of my date, and frankly, I was afraid of what I might find, so I just swallowed it and prayed that it was just the bottom of the pot.  Well, by the end of the night, I'm not feeling too well.  You know, I couldn't get too far away from a bathroom? Now I know that it is hard to prove, but I had cereal for breakfast with toast that had honey and peanut butter on it.  Chilis was lunch.  And I just had noodles for dinner, but symptoms started too soon after that.  I can't prove in court that it was Chilis' chili, but suffice it to say, I won't be eating that again.

The food here is ALWAYS consistently good and they always add new dishes to the menu... My wife and I had lunch their today and the server "Scottee" was EXCELLENT very attentive, great personality and most importantly made sure that our glasses were always filled....

This place is awful the service is awful the management is awful! Visited this location for dinner on Saturday March 14.  Service was ok, food was ok, pretty much what you would expect for most Chilis locations.  The number one thing that could have been improved upon..is knowing the ingredients for dishes and being willing to find out whether a menu item contains an item that could cause an allergic reaction.  It actually took 3 requests to get an appropriate and knowledgeable answer.  The question?  Does this item contain WALNUTS?  Not all food allergies are just to peanuts and in most cases, simply looking at the ingredient list on the package will answer that question.  I don't remember who eventually discovered the answer, but it WASN'T our server.  This is the difference between good service and GREAT service, going out of your way to answer a simple question.

Food is ok, price a little high for quality. The wife and I tried the Parmesan sweet potatoes fries, not good at all.

We waited for quite some time, and then finally after my husband got up looking for our waitress and asked the waitress where our appetizers and salad were, then they were brought out, BUT what followed them were our meals. The table was bombarded with plates and food and we wanted to eat our appetizers first which then made all of us eat our dinner cold. We expressed our irritation to the waitress and the runners but of course nothing but and "oh sorry" was done. At this time the manager should have come out without us even having to ask to check up since we very much so expressed our irritation. Another problem, the 3 nieces had kid meals and the waitress never brought out their soda's, so again my husband went back to find her and told her that she forgot, and she came back with an attitude saying that we never told her to bring them soda. I heard my brother-in-law tell her to bring them sodas. Both my sister and I used to waitress at a different Chili's when we were younger and this by far was the worst we have experienced from them. Typically the highest/best server works the bar area and this server acted as if it was her first night. She obviously didn't put the food orders in correctly and caused all the food to come out at once. Which is fine, I get it we are human, but make up for it. Tell the Manager what you did, apologize for your mistake, and make up for your lousy service. To top off the experience, I called my sister just now to ask how she was because both my husband and I had stomach issues (reason why I decided to write the review) and her and her husband and kids also had stomach issues! Save yourself the stomach bug and horrible service and try either another Chili's or Applebee's.

Finally writing this. Well it was two days ago but who could forget a spectacular turn around for Chili's. I never really ate there before the last year or so. After going to Chili's in Moreno Valley and having terrible food, rude, delayed, wrong items service and the manager doing nothing to correct it really, we decided that Chili's can kick rocks. According to friends in MoVal it has not gotten any better with the staff that that location even after the last year of cooling off.... Now to the good part. Chili's took me at my word listened and took down the names and times. They sent me chili's bucks (lack of a better term) in the amount of $25.00 for my bad service.  We decided to give the Chili's in Lake Elsinore a shot.  Server: Scotty (she was the best) Server: Cammie (not our server but came to visit and make fun of Scotty and see how we were doing. Sarcasm heals all wounds) Manager: Jeff (he came over checked in on us and made sure Scotty was being good) Sarcasm aside they were all nice people and we all interacted great. The food was perfect, hot, on time, and the way we ordered it. They never really forgot about us or any other table as they all appear to work together at this location. Jeff and the management staff deserve a round of applause for encouraging their servers to be outgoing, friendly, and yet professional and detail oriented.  Scotty took care of all of our needs and was so funny when she saw the Chili's bucks and how much her eye got a surprised look. I explained and we both agreed that Chili's Lake Elsinore is definitely not Moreno Valley.  I wish other restaurants would realize that the staff is the face of the company. The food is second to them and that the atmosphere really does make a difference when we are paying for dinners. Lake Elsinore Chili's seems to have figured it all out. Bill was over a hundred before the discount's (chili's bucks and senior citizen for my mom) they made every effort to be the best they could after a long and semi negative day they knew nothing about. The three people mentioned in this case deserve a raise and high five.
